channel.title: Make a item give random items
channel.description: How could i make like a Casket, when you click open it gives you something random like zammy plate or something. Casket = Id 7237 Any one help?

item.title: Make a item give random items
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

My MSN is fake in my profile, I don’t have MSN.

Read full topic
item.source: Make a item give random items

item.title: Make a item give random items
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

I don’t remember reading that post… I could tell you how to add it in Item, but it’s been done for you (Telenim and myself). And if it’s in Item, you would need it to remain Item.casket(); Just look for the item clicking packet.

Read full topic
item.source: Make a item give random items

item.title: Make a item give random items
item.dc:creator: @poopy1234 poopy1234
item.description:
@poopy1234 wrote:

[quote=“poopy1234, post:16, topic:288304”][quote author=_™ link=topic=381144.msg2864356#msg2864356 date=1247361901]
Since you added casket to your client, make Item.casket(); to casket(); and where’s if(itemID == at?
[/quote]
It’s in there, and where in item.java do i add the casket id. im kind of lost lol :s[/quote]
lol help me instead of bickering
i appreciate you guys trying to help

Read full topic
item.source: Make a item give random items

item.title: Make a item give random items
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:17, topic:288304”][quote author=_ link=topic=381144.msg2864360#msg2864360 date=1247362046]

You also need

public int cracker() { return cracker[(int)(Math.random()*cracker.length)]; }

Ya know, just while we’re throwin codes out off the top of our heads.

i added ur msn to. give me a few mins.

And why does he get it? I’ma write up a destruct code for your computer.

I would of added you but when i go to your profile it says hidden, and ok idc.
I’m just trying to get help,
i just threw it in my client.java somewhere lol but i got this error

client.java:14149: cannot find symbol symbol : variable itemID location: class client if(itemID == 7237){ ^ client.java:14150: cannot find symbol symbol : method casket() location: class Item Item.casket(); ^

You haven’t declared or defined the variable casket.

  • in your Item class.
  • in the item class.

My Item class doesn’t have casket(), so why would he be using mine? Therefore a possessive is needed
[/quote]
When you’re referring to class files, you say the. The client class. Your client class is technically incorrect even though it is in English.[/quote]
English is a bitch of a language.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote="_™, post:15, topic:288304"][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=381144.msg2864359#msg2864359 date=1247361988]

You also need

public int cracker() { return cracker[(int)(Math.random()*cracker.length)]; }

Ya know, just while we’re throwin codes out off the top of our heads.

i added ur msn to. give me a few mins.

And why does he get it? I’ma write up a destruct code for your computer.

I would of added you but when i go to your profile it says hidden, and ok idc.
I’m just trying to get help,
i just threw it in my client.java somewhere lol but i got this error

client.java:14149: cannot find symbol symbol : variable itemID location: class client if(itemID == 7237){ ^ client.java:14150: cannot find symbol symbol : method casket() location: class Item Item.casket(); ^

You haven’t declared or defined the variable casket.

  • in your Item class.
  • in the item class.
    [/quote]

My Item class doesn’t have casket(), so why would he be using mine? Therefore a possessive is needed ;)[/quote]
When you’re referring to class files, you say the. The client class. Your client class is technically incorrect even though it is in English.

item.title: Make a item give random items
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

if(itemID == 7237){ Item.casket(); }This belongs somewhere in your client class.
[hr]

public static int casket[] = {1040,995};This goes into your Item class, find the correct places, I just quickly wrote something up what I thought it would be, but if any errors post here I might be able to help.

Read full topic

int[] array = {1,2,3};

Example of method returning zero:

public int return() { return 0; }
